title: Oktoberfest Chicken and Red Cabbage Recipe
description: This Oktoberfest chicken and red cabbage recipe features chicken thighs, cabbage, bacon, and apple for a sweet and sour German-inspired main dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Oktoberfest Chicken and Red Cabbage 4.6 (115) 98 Reviews 37 Photos This Oktoberfest recipe for chicken and red cabbage is crazy simple. I adore Bavarian cuisine. My husband and I ate at wonderful German restaurants when we lived in San Francisco. Now I have to make my own since there's no good German food where we live. Submitted by HerbanSpoons Updated on March 24, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 37 37 37 37 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 25 mins Total Time: 1 hr 45 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 strips bacon 1 tablespoon bacon drippings ¼ cup all-purpose flour ½ teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste ½ teaspoon smoked paprika 2 pounds skinless chicken thighs 1 red onion, sliced 1 large apple, cored and sliced 1 head red cabbage, cored and sliced ½ cup red wine vinegar ¼ cup dry red wine ¼ cup brown sugar ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon (Optional) Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook bacon in a large oven-safe or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate until cool; crumble bacon. Leave drippings in the skillet. Whisk flour, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and smoked paprika together in a medium bowl until evenly combined; dredge chicken thighs in flour and shake off excess. Cook chicken in drippings in the skillet over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes per side; transfer chicken to a plate. Drain and discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings from the skillet. Add onion and apple; cook and stir until onion is translucent and apple softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in cabbage and bacon; season with kosher salt. Cook, stirring often, until cabbage is softened, 5 to 8 minutes. Add vinegar and red wine to cabbage mixture; stir in brown sugar and cinnamon until well combined. Bring to a boil; cook until sauce is reduced by half, stirring often, about 10 minutes. Place chicken thighs on cabbage in the skillet. Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage is tender and chicken is cooked through, about 40 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 222 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 271 Calories 9g Fat 24g Carbs 23g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 271 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 3g 13% Cholesterol 72mg 24% Sodium 292mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 24g 9% Dietary Fiber 3g 12% Total Sugars 14g Protein 23g 45% Vitamin C 62mg 69% Calcium 69mg 5% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 505mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Oktoberfest Chicken and Red Cabbage 01 of 37 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 37 Photo by  DREGINEK 10/09/2023 We loved this and each bite more than the last! Used a pink lady apple and regular, green cabbage as I didn’t have red. My red onion was on the smaller side so at the last minute, I also added a chopped shallot. Cooking down the cabbage took at least 10 min and cooking down the wine/vinegar- took me another 10 so I could have waited to start the oven until I got to either of these two steps. This smelled heavenly! The flavors of apples, onions, wine and cabbage was reminiscent of a sweet sauerkraut. Perfect Octoberfest dish or, just because it’s fall! Thanks HerbanSpoons!! 03 of 37 Photo by  Jaselyn Sonick Pearson 02/27/2021 04 of 37 Photo by  David Vera 02/17/2021 Loved it. 05 of 37 Photo by  mitz 12/13/2020 06 of 37 Photo by  Karen 10/22/2020 We have made this twice in two weeks! The only changes were to use half the chicken (there are only two of us) and we added quartered new potatoes in with the apples and cabbage. We highly recommend added this to your dinner rotation. 07 of 37 Photo by  dBob_808 10/22/2020 What a treat! Followed the recipe exactly as written and the entire family went nuts for it. Used a deeper Dutch Oven pan because of the sheer volume of product (especially cabbage). Others have commented that this takes a while with all the steps but believe me the end result is so worth it. Not sure how anyone could find this "bland" as there is so much going on with the flavors. No one found it "sweet" either - the chicken and the cabbage work together to provide the balance. During the preparation I was nervous because TBH based on the various "essences" that present themselves you'll think you're doing something wrong. The big reveal, however, is when you take it out of the oven - prepare yourself for German food bliss. Served this with boiled Baby Red potatoes. Many thanks to the poster of this recipe. 08 of 37 Photo by  Aaron A 10/15/2020 Chicken was very juicy and the cabbage turned out great. The only thing I would change is to season the chicken directly as opposed to the flour. My chicken would have been better with more seasoning. Good recipe! 09 of 37 Photo by  Marcie 10/14/2020 10 of 37 Photo by  Susie 10/09/2020 Left out the onions 1/2 the sugar double red wine. It was amazing!! 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Ryann's Spicy Grilled Fish Tacos Fried Fish Tacos with Chipotle-Lime Salsa 3 Ratings Grilled Fish Tacos with Creamy Cilantro Coleslaw 3 Ratings Broiled Tilapia Fish Tacos with Cilantro-Lime Slaw Marinated Mexican Fish Tacos Slaw 1 Rating California Chicken 403 Ratings Fish Tacos with Honey-Cumin Cilantro Slaw and Chipotle Mayo 482 Ratings Anaheim Fish Tacos 158 Ratings Fish Taco Cabbage Wraps 9 Ratings Fried Fish Tacos to Remind You of Baja California Baked Cod Fish Tacos 19 Ratings Island Chicken with Fruit Salsa 39 Ratings Blackened Tilapia Fish Tacos 3 Ratings Air Fryer Crispy Fish Tacos with Slaw 9 Ratings Green Apple, Jicama, and Prawn Salad with Mint, Lemongrass, and Dijon Dressing 8 Ratings Nadine's Tangy Fish Tacos Slaw 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: HerbanSpoons
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Cook bacon in a large oven-safe or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate until cool; crumble bacon. Leave drippings in the skillet.;Whisk flour, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and smoked paprika together in a medium bowl until evenly combined; dredge chicken thighs in flour and shake off excess.;Cook chicken in drippings in the skillet over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes per side; transfer chicken to a plate.;Drain and discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings from the skillet. Add onion and apple; cook and stir until onion is translucent and apple softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in cabbage and bacon; season with kosher salt. Cook, stirring often, until cabbage is softened, 5 to 8 minutes.;Add vinegar and red wine to cabbage mixture; stir in brown sugar and cinnamon until well combined. Bring to a boil; cook until sauce is reduced by half, stirring often, about 10 minutes. Place chicken thighs on cabbage in the skillet.;Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage is tender and chicken is cooked through, about 40 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
